channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overgrown hedge, 1st September
item.description:
Hedge encroaching on pavement making it very narrow and difficult to pass
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 132 Cheltenham Road, Bishops Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped Flood warning sign, 1st September
item.description:
"Flood" warning sign, dumped / abandoned on pavement along A40 Lansdown Road, outside Glencairn Court (GL51 6QN). No flooding at this location, so assume sign has been dumped, or has literally fallen off the back of a passing lorry. Needs to be removed (been there weeks).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 3 Glencairn Court Lansdown Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken cover, 31st August
item.description:
There is a broken cover on the verge, which is a hazard. It is directly adjacent to a highways drain and appears to be linked

item.title: 400mm deep pothole in carriageway, 30th August
item.description:
There is a very deep pothole on the western side of the railway bridge at Claydon Lane, Homedowns, Tewkesbury. The opening is only about 100m across, but underneath is a very large void some 300-400mm across. This is in iminent danger of collapse.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Claydon Lane, Homedowns
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned car obstructing cycle lane on Henrietta Street since Thursday morning, 29th August
item.description:
A red Renault registration OY07WWP has been parked on Henrietta Street, fully obstructing the cycle lane, partially on the pavement, and at a bit of an angle since early Thursday 26/8/21 The obstruction of the cycle lane forces cyclists into oncoming traffic, which is dangerous.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 17 Henrietta Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pot holes branches overhanging dangerous tree., 28th August
item.description:
Overhanging branches vehicles unable to get down lane safely... concerns we cannot get deliveries oil etc. Also many pot holes have not been repaired , one or two accidents have happened......... dangerous tree has already been reported last year nothing done about it. one tree was marked further down the lane some time ago. Nothing done about it so it fell down and someone could have been killed. Please help.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Woodside Painswick Road, Coopers Hill
Report on FixMyStreet
